abstract: Unlike the last Internet boom, entrepreneurs in “Silicon Alley,” New York’s venture-capital community, is filled with older, more experienced entrepreneurs who focus more on long-term profits. Internet heavyweights like Google have opened up ambitious new offices in the Big Apple. But some things never change, according to The New York Sun’s Jay Akasie: Just like in the olden days, Silicon Alley still takes a distant second to the West Coast.
lead_paragraph: Unlike the last Internet boom, entrepreneurs in “Silicon Alley,” New York’s venture-capital community, is filled with older, more experienced entrepreneurs who focus more on long-term profits. Internet heavyweights like Google have opened up ambitious new offices in the Big Apple. But some things never change, according to The New York Sun’s Jay Akasie: Just like in the olden days, Silicon Alley still takes a distant second to the West Coast.
